math_problem.A2467: On a blackboard a stranger writes the values of $s_{7}(n)^{2}$ for $n=0,1, \ldots, 7^{20}-1$, where $s_{7}(n)$ denotes the sum of digits of $n$ in base 7 . Compute the average value of all the numbers on the board. Instead of computing the average of the squares of the digit sums, simply find $m = \mathrm{Var}(S) - 65$, where $S$ is the sum of digits in base 7 of a uniformly random $n$ from $0$ to $7^{20}-1$.

math_problem.A2488: The number 3003 is the only number known to appear eight times in Pascal's triangle, at positions $\binom{3003}{1},\binom{3003}{3002},\binom{a}{2},\binom{a}{a-2},\binom{15}{b},\binom{15}{15-b},\binom{14}{6},\binom{14}{8}$. Compute $a+b(15-b)$.

A2467: Mathematics -> Applied Mathematics -> Statistics -> Probability -> Counting Methods -> Combinations

A2488: Mathematics -> Applied Mathematics -> Statistics -> Probability -> Counting Methods -> Combinations
